text: But suffice to say that this is what we mean when we say upward causation is really from small things to big things, because the top-down things are often seen as big, and the things that are just on the fabric level of reality are often seen as small, rightly or wrongly.

text: And
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The story when you have this type of a upward causation model, again, that smaller things cause bigger things, is the genes are upstream of the behavior, or the cell damage is upstream of the organs.

text: So it makes sense, and there's also a related idea called supervenience that is that, is there a relationship between changing the smaller thing and the bigger thing changing?

text: However, what Noble ends up framing in this no privileged level of causation model is that, yes, there is influence or flow from so-called the upward direction.

text: top-down causation that can be equally important for regulating the system.
